article_metadata.description: Here’s one thing economists and business managers rarely agree on: who bears the cost of employee benefits? Most employers believe that the firm ultimately shoulders the burden. If health costs go up, they reason, profits must go down and vice versa. But economists believe that employee benefits are a dollar-for-dollar substitute [...]
article_metadata.author: John C. Goodman
